趕.definition: to overtake; to catch up with; to hurry; to rush; to try to catch (the bus etc); to drive (cattle etc) forward; to drive (sb) away; to avail oneself of (an opportunity); until; by (a certain time)

趕上.definition: to keep up with; to catch up with; to overtake; to chance upon; in time for

趕不上.definition: can't keep up with; can't catch up with; cannot overtake

趕不及.definition: not enough time (to do sth); too late (to do sth)

趕前不趕後.definition: it's better to hurry at the start than to rush later (idiom)

趕工.definition: to work against the clock; to hurry with work to get it done in time

趕得及.definition: there is still time (to do sth); to be able to do sth in time; to be able to make it

趕忙.definition: to hurry; to hasten; to make haste

趕早.definition: as soon as possible; at the first opportunity; the sooner the better; before it's too late

趕明兒.definition: (coll.) some day; one of these days

趕時髦.definition: to keep up with the latest fashion

趕海.definition: (dialect) to gather seafood at the beach while the tide is out; to comb the beach for shellfish, crabs or other marine life

趕盡殺絕.definition: to kill to the last one (idiom); to exterminate; to eradicate; ruthless

趕羊.definition: to drive sheep; to herd sheep

趕考.definition: to go and take an imperial examination

趕腳.definition: to work as a carter or porter; to transport goods for a living (esp. by donkey)

趕英超美.definition: to catch up with England and surpass the USA (economic goal)

趕走.definition: to drive out; to turn back

趕跑.definition: to drive away; to force out; to repel

趕路.definition: to hasten on with one's journey; to hurry on

趕集.definition: to go to market; to go to a fair

趕鴨子上架.definition: lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom); fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
